alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:18PM EDT until June 12 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON...NORTHWESTERN HYDE...NORTHEASTERN BEAUFORT AND SOUTHERN TYRRELL COUNTIES... At 418 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Alligator Lake to near Pungo, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Belhaven, Sladesville, Killkenny, Ponzer, Gum Neck, Kilkenny, Scranton, Fairfield, Pungo, Leechville, Rose Bay, Pungo Lake, Alligator Lake and Pantego. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889.
